Title: Most Nigerian workers to be exempted from personal income tax, says Oyedele
Summary: Chairman of the Presidential Committee on Fiscal Policy and Tax Reforms, Taiwo Oyedele, said no fewer than 98 per cent of Nigerian workers would be exempted from paying personal income tax when the new tax regime takes effect in January 2026 .

Title: ‘Over 60% of Nigerian-trained radiographers practising abroad’
Summary: More than 60 per cent of Nigerian-trained radiographers trained in Nigeria are now practising abroad . The Radiography Lecturers Association of Nigeria (RLAN) has raised the alarm .

Title: Tinubu declares emergency on insecurity, backs govs on state police
Summary: Tinubu declares emergency on insecurity, backs govs on state police . Federal Government has signalled unprecedented support for state police and decentralised security frameworks . Southern leaders insist only a multi-tiered policing system is needed .

Title: OPay bags double awards for  organisational excellence
Summary: OPay has been recognised with two major honours for organisational performance in financial crime prevention and governance, risk management, and compliance . The financial technology company has reaffirmed its industry leadership and commitment to excellence .

Title: SEC sets January 2026 as deadline for ISA compliance
Summary: SEC sets January 2026 as deadline for ISA compliance . The Securities and Exchange Commission has issued a directive requiring all capital market operators to declare their level of compliance with the Investments and Securities Act (ISA) 2025 .

Title: 6 Parties, 3 Decades, One Dream: Will Atiku get it right in 2027?
Summary: Atiku's latest resignation is the third time he would be leaving the PDP and the fifth time he has changed party platforms since 1999 . Atiku has been in power since 1999, but has not resigned from his party platform .

Title: 2 killed as vigilante foils bandits’ attack on Kogi school
Summary: Aiyetoro Kiri in Kabba Bunu Local Government Area of Kogi State yesterday foiled bandits’ invasion of Kiri High School . The students were prevented from being abducted by a vigilante group .

Title: Nnamdi Kanu: Senior lawyers differ on conviction, life imprisonment
Summary: Indigenous People of Biafra leader, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu, convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment on terrorism charges . The Federal High Court, Abuja, convicted him and sentenced him last week . Kanu is one of the most contentious criminal proceedings in Nigeria’s recent history .

Title: NDA begins admission into 78 Regular Course Friday
Summary: Nigerian Defence Academy has announced the commencement of online applications for admission into its 78 Regular Course, opening on November 28, 2025, and closing on April 30, 2026 . The announcement was made in a statement issued on Wednesday by the Academy Registrar, who said the application is open to eligible male and female Nigerians .

Title: Trigger-happy policeman shoots teenager dead in Oyo
Summary: A yet-to-be-identified trigger-happy policeman has allegedly shot a teenager identified simply as DMX dead in the Alakia area of Ibadan, Oyo State . The incident occurred on Tuesday after an altercation between the officer and the deceased victim . The teenager had already lost a significant amount of blood before receiving medical attention
